Package de.db.derpate.handler

Class FilterHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.db.derpate.handler.FilterHandler
  • public class FilterHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This handler manages ServletFilters and checks, if a request applies to all filters.
    Author:
    MichelBlank
    See Also:
    de.db.derpate.servlet.filter

      Filters set by constructor

      Constructor Description
      FilterHandler​(@NonNull ServletFilter... filters)
      Constructor, that expects ServletFilters, that get stored and used later, when handling a request

      boolean handleFilter​(@NonNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req, @NonNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
      Uses the filters to check, if a request was valid and responds with an error (set by ServletFilter.getErrorStatusCode()), if one of the filters forbids request.
      @Nullable ServletFilter isValid​(@NonNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)

    • Constructor Detail

      • FilterHandler

        public FilterHandler​(@NonNull ServletFilter... filters)
        Constructor, that expects ServletFilters, that get stored and used later, when handling a request
        Parameters:
        filters - array of ServletFilters. May not be null.

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        public @Nullable ServletFilter isValid​(@NonNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
        Checks, if all filters apply and returns the filter, that was failing.
        Parameters:
        req - the HttpServletRequest that should be checked
        Returns:
        the ServletFilter that makes the request failing or null, if all filters apply

      • handleFilter

        public boolean handleFilter​(@NonNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                            @NonNull javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Uses the filters to check, if a request was valid and responds with an error (set by ServletFilter.getErrorStatusCode()), if one of the filters forbids request.
        Parameters:
        req - HttpServletRequest
        resp - HttpServletResponse
        Returns:
        true, if all filters applied; false, if at least one filter forbids the request
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an input or output exception occurs, while sending error
